title: What Are You Solving For
text: You are solving for the Hamilton's speed in the congested freeways.
speech: You are solving for the Hamilton's speed in the congested freeways.
pacedSpeech: You are solving for the Hamilton's speed in the congested freeways.

title: Make a Variable
text: Create a variable to represent the speed in the congested freeways. Let the variable be $$x$$.
speech: Create a variable to represent the speed in the congested freeways. Let the variable be  x .
pacedSpeech: Create a variable to represent the speed in the congested freeways. Let the variable be   x

title: Time Elapsed
text: Determine how much time each part of the journey took using subtraction.
speech: Determine how much time each part of the journey took using subtraction.
pacedSpeech: Determine how much time each part of the journey took using subtraction.

title: Time Elapsed Answer
text: 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM is two hours. 4:00 PM to 6:30 PM is $$2.5$$ hours long. So, he spent two hours in the congested freeways and $$2.5$$ hours in the desert.
speech: 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM is two hours. 4:00 PM to 6:30 PM is  2.5  hours long. So, he spent two hours in the congested freeways and  2.5,  hours in the desert.

title: Translate to Equation
text: Translate the situation into an equation using the variable. Remember that $$distance=speed time$$.
speech: Translate the situation into an equation using the variable. Remember that , distance is equal to speedtime .
pacedSpeech: Translate the situation into an equation using the variable. Remember that  , distance is equal to speedtime

title: The Equation
text: Multiply the speeds by the time it takes for each respective part of the journey to get the equation $$2x+\operatorname{1.75}\left(2.5x\right)=255$$ (this is the combined distance).
speech: Multiply the speeds by the time it takes for each respective part of the journey to get the equation  2 x plus 1.75 of 2.5 x is equal to 255  (this is the combined distance).
pacedSpeech: Multiply the speeds by the time it takes for each respective part of the journey to get the equation   2 x plus 1.75 of 2.5 x is equal to 255

title: Solving the Equation
text: After solving the equation, what do you get for $$x$$?

subHints.title: Solving the Equation
subHints.text: To solve the equation $$2x+\operatorname{1.75}\left(2.5x\right)=255$$, we follow these steps: 2x+4.375x=255-->6.375x=255-->x=40.

speech: After solving the equation, what do you get for  x ?
